docs.lead_paragraph: NEW ORLEANS — Representative Michele Bachmann of Minnesota, the latest candidate to join the Republican presidential campaign, suggested Friday that President Obama secretly wanted Medicare to go bankrupt so retirees would be forced to enroll in the new national health care law.

headline.main: Bachmann Accuses Obama of Secret Medicare Plan

docs.abstract: Representative Michele Bachmann suggested that President Obama secretly wanted Medicare to go bankrupt so retirees would be forced to enroll in the new national health care law.
docs.snippet: Representative Michele Bachmann suggested that President Obama secretly wanted Medicare to go bankrupt so retirees would be forced to enroll in the new national health care law.

docs.lead_paragraph: Like countries, companies rise and fall, and some of them rise again.

headline.main: Podcast: I.B.M., Diamonds and Paying for Medicare

docs.abstract: A look at the latest Weekend Business podcast, and a listen.
docs.snippet: A look at the latest Weekend Business podcast, and a listen.

docs.lead_paragraph: Jerry J. Borg was a bit-part actor and a small-time inventor, but his day job was as an accountant for New York State. On Sept. 11, 2001, he was working in an office a block or two from the World Trade Center.

headline.main: An Actor, Inventor, Accountant, and Now, a 9/11 Victim

docs.abstract: Medical examiners found that Jerry J. Borg died Dec. 15, 2010, of complications of pulmonary sarcoidosis, an inflammatory disease of the lungs, and that it was caused by inhaling dust thrown up during the collapse of the twin towers.
docs.snippet: Medical examiners found that Jerry J. Borg died Dec. 15, 2010, of complications of pulmonary sarcoidosis, an inflammatory disease of the lungs, and that it was caused by inhaling dust thrown up during the collapse of the twin towers.

keywords.value: Office of the Chief Medical Examiner of the City of New York
keywords.name: organizations

docs.lead_paragraph: The story so far: McKinsey released the alleged results of a study showing that large numbers of firms will drop health insurance coverage once the Affordable Care Act goes fully into effect. This is very different from the results of other studies, notably the Congressional Budget Office assessment of the act.
docs.abstract: The case of the phantom study.
docs.snippet: The case of the phantom study.

docs.lead_paragraph: Government workers swarmed Trenton after Gov. Chris Christie and legislative leaders agreed to sharply increase the contributions public employees must make into their health insurance and pensions plans.

headline.seo: State Workers Swarm Trenton to Oppose Health and Pension Increases
headline.main: Workers Swarm Trenton on Benefit Changes
headline.print_headline: State Workers Swarm Trenton to Protest Charges to Their Health and Pension Plans

docs.snippet: Government workers swarmed Trenton after Gov. Chris Christie and legislative leaders agreed to sharply increase the contributions public employees must make into their health insurance and pensions plans.

docs.lead_paragraph: 9:39 p.m. | Updated Four days after declining to criticize Mitt Romney, the former governor of Massachusetts, during a Republican presidential debate, Tim Pawlenty acknowledged his flub in a Twitter message on Thursday. docs.lead_paragraph: Michael W. Peregrine is a partner at the law firm of McDermott Will & Emery, concentrating on issues involving corporate governance and leadership and director-officer liability.

headline.main: No D.& O. Liability Risk?  Wouldn’t That Be Nice

docs.abstract: Contrary to arguments that directors and officers face little liability risk, a lawyer specializing in corporate governance issues asserts that this risk is real.
docs.snippet: Contrary to arguments that directors and officers face little liability risk, a lawyer specializing in corporate governance issues asserts that this risk is real.

docs.lead_paragraph: A colleague who practices pediatrics recently bemoaned the fact that several insurers in his state no longer reimburse him for each medical service he performs. Instead, the insurers give his practice a budget for each patient, and he can earn more by meeting certain quality goals.
docs.abstract: Public reports that rate doctors and hospitals and link pay to performance can inspire some to do better, but in some cases they backfire.
docs.snippet: Public reports that rate doctors and hospitals and link pay to performance can inspire some to do better, but in some cases they backfire.

docs.lead_paragraph: Most of us don’t look forward to visiting the dentist, despite attempts to woo us with free toothbrushes. But a new Web site aims to at least take some of the pain out of the paying the bill.

headline.main: Comparison Shopping for Discounted Dental Care

docs.abstract: Brighter.com helps you compare dental costs in your area.
docs.snippet: Brighter.com helps you compare dental costs in your area.
